system.description: You surgically graft a new anatomy and associated trait into the target creature. You must have the relevant anatomy on hand to attempt a graft. The procedure takes a day and is dangerous to the target. Make a biomantic, medical, or other relevant test to integrate the xenograft: Roll Effect ≤1 Catastrophe. Patient suffers severe corruption, then dies. 2–5 Severe corruption exposure, [[/r 6d6]] damage, new trait occupies 2 slots. 6–10 Regular corruption exposure, [[/r 4d6]] damage, new trait occupies 2 slots. 11–15 Mild corruption exposure, [[/r 2d6]] damage, new trait occupies 1 slot. 16–19 [[/r 2d6]] damage, new trait occupies 1 slot. 20≤ New trait occupies 1 slot. The patient can use the xenograft once they have healed from the procedure.

power.overcharge: The procedure takes less than an hour. It is very dangerous for the experimental subject.
